DOC.brief_summary: Expenditures on material supplies and medications constitute the greatest per capita costs for surgical missions. We hypothesized that supply acquisition at nonprofit organization cost would lead to significant cost-savings compared to supply acquisition at US academic institution costs from the provider perspective for hernia repairs and minor procedures during a surgical mission in the Dominican Republic.
DOC.criteria: Patients presenting to the Institute of Latin American Concern Center for surgical procedure, previously screened by local healthcare workers. Require hernia surgery, hydrocelectomy, excision of benign cutaneous mass. Did not require hernia surgery, hydrocelectomy, excision of benign cutaneous mass.
